cardinfo.CI: Pterocarpus - Indian Kino Tree/Indian Kino Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Pterocarpus marsupium, or the Indian Kino Tree is a medium to large, deciduous tree that can grow up to 30 metres tall. It is native to India, Nepal, and Sri Lanka, where it occurs in parts of the Western Ghats in the Karnataka-Kerala region. It is also known by the names Malabar Kino, Benga, Bijiayasal (in western Nepal), Piasal (Oriya[2]), Venkai, and many others.

English: East indian kino
Hindi: विजयसार पेड़, पेटरोकार्पस मार्सूपियम
Kannada: Baenga mara, Bange, Bendaga mara
Malayalam: ബിജക, അസന, വേങ്ങ, Venga, Honne, Karintakara, Karinthagara
Marathi: असाणा, Asaaha, Asan, Asana
Sanskrit: Asana, Beejaka, Petaca, Bandhukavriksha
Tamil: உதிரவேங்கை மரம், Vengai, Acamai, Acanapann
Telugu: ఏగిస, Aine, Asana, Beddagi, Beeja saramu
Urdu: Bijasar, Dam al akhwain
